info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 13 at 8:57PM EDT until June 13 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central McDowell County in western North Carolina... Southwestern Burke County in western North Carolina... * Until 945 PM EDT. * At 857 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles northeast of Marion, or over Lake James, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Morganton, Drexel, Glen Alpine, Lake James State Park, South Mountains State Park, Lake James, Nebo, Oak Hill, Marion and Table Rock. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
